items.title: BBC News app

items.title: Fortnight-long special cleanliness campaign launched in  Thiruvananthapuram Railway Division
Three held for cheating SBI of ₹2.5 crore through two loans by producing fake documents in Mangaluru
items.summary: The city police have arrested three persons in connection with two cases of cheating the State Bank of India of a total of ₹2.5 crore by taking two loans by producing fake documents

items.title: An exhibition of saris in Chennai weaves together stories of nostalgia, grief, and celebration
items.summary: Laya, a portmanteau pop-up between September 18 and 20, tells a heart-warming tale of weaving saris that signal celebration from loss

items.title: Car plunges into cellar pit at Gandhi Bazaar in Bengaluru, four injured

items.summary: Concerns grow over the government's plans to reform special needs education in  England.

items.title: AAI marks ‘Yatri Sewa Diwas’ with health camps, cultural events at Vizag airport
Standoff between contractor and workers leads to waste accumulation across city
items.summary: Contract company filed a police complaint saying keys of garbage removal vehicles were taken away from the workshop by some employees, but workers’ union staunchly denied it

items.title: Slot gets late birthday gift as Isak samples power of Anfield
items.summary: Liverpool boss Arne Slot enjoys a dramatic birthday as record signing Alexander Isak samples Anfield's Champions League power, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

items.title: State Cabinet approves ‘CM With Me’ initiative to boost public-government interface and transparency
items.summary: A key feature of the programme is the creation of a comprehensive Citizen Connect Centre, which will serve as a central hub for citizen feedback, grievance redressal and public communication

items.title: Raj Thackeray’s cartoon targets Amit Shah, son, over Indo-Pak match
items.summary: The cartoon features the question in the background: “Who actually won? Who actually lost?” The post comes after India won in the recent Asia Cup match played against Pakistan.

items.title: Three officers killed in Pennsylvania shooting, with two others critical
items.summary: Officials said the suspect has been "neutralised" and there is no further threat to the public.

items.title: Election Commission ready to roll out SIR in Karnataka anytime after Sept. 25
items.summary: After the completion of SIR to remove dead, migrated and duplicate voters from rolls, the ECI expects the voting percentage in urban centres such as Bengaluru to go up in future election

items.title: City witnesses sudden downpour in the evening
Interest rates expected to be held by Bank of England
items.summary: The Bank rate was cut in August but many analysts do not expect any further reductions this year.

items.title: Human Rights Watch accuses Israel forces of displacing South Syria residents
items.summary: The statement by HRW quoted the Israeli military as saying it is operating in southern Syria "to protect the citizens of the State of Israel" and that its activities are "in accordance with international law"

items.title: 'Day by day, year by year' - Borg on cancer diagnosis
items.summary: Tennis legend Bjorn Borg speaks to BBC Breakfast about his prostate cancer diagnosis and his rivalry-turned-friendship with John McEnroe.

items.title: 75 years of Vishnuvardhan: Dream roles and unfulfilled projects
items.summary: Remembering versatile Kannada actor Vishnuvardhan on his 75th birth anniversary, young filmmakers talk about his untapped potential in the industry

items.title: Europeans say Iran yet to take necessary actions to stop 'snapback' of UN sanctions
items.summary: The comments from the German Foreign Ministry and the European Union came after a call Iran had September 17 with representatives of France, Germany and the United Kingdom, as well as the EU's top diplomat, Kaja Kallas

items.title: Palaniswami has pledged AIADMK with the BJP, says Stalin
items.summary: Mr. Palaniswami wants to safeguard himself from raids by Central agencies. He did nothing for the State when he was in power, and did not have the courage to raise his voice against the Centre to safeguard the interests of the State, says Tamil Nadu Chief Minister

items.title: Delhi court declines urgent hearing on Adani gag order, journalists decry takedown notices
items.summary: In their appeals in the case, journalists have contended that the court passed an over-broad and all-encompassing restraining order without identifying which specific content was defamatory

items.title: Arguments on Gulmarg lease, PIL on environmental issues to be heard on next date of hearing: J&K High Court
items.summary: In August, the High Court sought a final stand of government, following two separate opinions submitted by Raj Bhawan and Chief Minister’s Office in sealed covers

items.title: Unemployment leading to unrest among youth: Congress

items.summary: Shiv Sena (UBT) Chief, the son of Meenatai Thackeray, reached the spot and criticised the incident, saying this is the work of a person who is either ashamed of his parents or attempting to burn Maharashtra
